question: The equilibrium constant at 298K for the reaction <katex>$A+B \Rightarrow C+D$</katex> is 100. If the initial concentrations of all the four species were 1M each, then equilibrium concentration of D (in mol <katex>$L^{-1}$</katex>) will be
explanation: Q = 1. K = 100. Q < K, reaction goes forward. Let change be x.
Eq concs: A(1-x), B(1-x), C(1+x), D(1+x).
